Memories.0: The absolute beauty of the park is what impressed me. I have been to many parts of the world, but the sheer diversity of the attractions within Yellowstone is hard to beat. -Doug
Memories.2: Driving around Yellowstone and having to stop for the buffalo who were walking in the middle of the road -Morgan
Memories.3: Picnic lunches and the river each day watching all the cousins play -Dana
Memories.5: I loved the algae stained pools of hot water and the numerous animals we encountered. -Grandpa
Memories.6: I loved the picnics we had each day in different parts of the park that led to playing in snow, water, and meadows. -Grammy

Memories.0: The chance to spend a week in a large beach house right on the beachin Mexico is a one in a lifetime opportunity. -Doug
Memories.1: Feeding raw chicken to alligators on our boat ride was scary but fun -Doug
Memories.2: Releasing baby sea turtles into the ocean at dusk, then running back to the beach house getting attacked by mosquitoes -Katie
Memories.3: Falling asleep and waking up to the sound of waves breaking -Dana
Memories.4: Boogie boarding in the ocean. I was the boogie board queen -Morgan
Memories.5: I loved the virgin Pina Colada drinks with their coconut taste. -Grandpa
Memories.6: Seeing the turtle nest near our place and then going down and helping the little turtle hatchlings get to the ocean-- in spite of the mosquitos. -Grammy

Memories.0: Spending the 4th of July in Telluride was great. -Doug
Memories.1: Looking out the window one morning and seeing a chipmunk going to town on a cantaloupe -Morgan
Memories.2: Hiking down under the waterfall was amazing -Katie
Memories.3: Riding the gondola down the mountain from our cabin into Telluride. -Dana
Memories.5: The huge size of the white-bark quaking asp trees, the deer grazing outside the window and the gondola rides over the mountains. -Grandpa
Memories.6: Taking family pictures in this beautiful country, having our total family together, and enjoying the setting of the place in the woods where we saw deer and other beauties of nature. -Grammy

Memories.0: I grew up as a kid loving Starky. -Doug
Memories.1: Marshmellow gun wars and playing shipwreck -Morgan
Memories.2: Catching crayfish then cooking and eating them -Katie
Memories.3: Placing rocks to form a natural hot spring pool along the side of the river -Dana
Memories.4: Four wheeling rides to the rim of Hells Canyon -Doug
Memories.5: Convergence of the hot and cold water in the creek. -Grandpa
Memories.6: Beginning a wonderful tradition of holding Crayton & Elva Leavitt Reunions every other year; we began with a heritage theme including pictures, memories, games and stories of great-greats, greats, and grands grandparents. -Grammy

Memories.0: This was the way to see Lake Powell. We stayed in two of the largest houseboats on the lake. -Doug
Memories.1: One of my uncles put a bunge cord on the tube he pulled his boat and we would get launched over the wakes -Morgan
Memories.2: 50 foot water slide into the lake -Katie
Memories.3: Jet skiing and riding boats along the beautiful red rock cliffs -Dana
Memories.4: I loved the slide they built for the kids to play on--such great fun going down the hill into the water. -Grandpa
Memories.5: The glorious scenery and on those luxurious boats with the slippery slide between them. -Grammy
